It was bred in the late nineteenth century by William Cook of Orpington, Kent in southeast England Kedu Chicken Indonesia Chicken kedu, chicken basil, or chicken cemani are local chicken breeds that have been developed in Java since the 12th century. Cemani chicken has a dominant gene that causes Wyandotte Chicken North America The Wyandotte is a dual purpose breed, raised for its brown eggs and yolk-skinned flesh. Shamo Chicken Thailand The Shamo breed is thought to have originated from Malay-type fighting cocks brought from Thailand in the early seventeenth century.
